items.title: Creator's Brain
items.description: An AI-powered SaaS platform for YouTube creators to analyze, optimize, and grow their content using advanced AI tools and insights.

caseStudy.problem: YouTube creators often struggle with poor-performing videos, low engagement, and creative fatigue due to manual scripting, thumbnail design, and title optimization.
caseStudy.solution: Built an AI-first SaaS product that reverse-engineers successful video strategies by using Claude 3.7 for intelligent content suggestions, YouTube API for real-time data, and Vercel AI SDK for interactive AI chat capabilities. Transcripts, thumbnails, and video reports are auto-generated to streamline content workflows.
caseStudy.impact: Early testers report a 30% increase in video engagement and a 20% boost in subscriber growth.

items.title: Collaborix
items.description: A real-time collaboration platform for remote teams, integrating AI-powered workflows and rich-text editing

caseStudy.problem: Remote teams faced inefficiencies due to fragmented tools, leading to communication breakdowns, delayed project timelines, and reduced productivity across distributed work environments.
caseStudy.solution: Developed a unified platform with real-time document editing, AI-driven workflow automation, and seamless user management using Next.js, Clerk for authentication, Cloudflare Workers for scalability, Firestore for real-time data, and Liveblocks for collaborative features.
caseStudy.impact: Boosted team productivity by 40% and reduced project completion time by 25% for over 50 enterprise clients, as measured by user feedback and performance analytics.

items.title: NextBlend
items.description: Performance-optimized design system built for Next.js applications

caseStudy.problem: Developers were struggling with performance issues when implementing complex UI components in Next.js applications.
caseStudy.solution: Created a lightweight, tree-shakable component library optimized specifically for Next.js with built-in performance monitoring.
caseStudy.impact: Reduced average page load times by 35% and decreased bundle sizes by 42% across client applications.
